title: المَوْصُول الحَرْفِيّ
description: Learn about المَوْصُول الحَرْفِيّ, particles that function like relative pronouns and form interpreted masdars: أَنْ، أَنَّ، كَيْ، لَوْ، مَا.

notes.title: What is المَوْصُول الحَرْفِيّ?
content: المَوْصُول الحَرْفِيّ (particle-like relative) refers to particles that, together with the clause following them, form a complete meaning equivalent to a masdar. Unlike الموصول الاسمي (الَّذِي، الَّتِي, etc.) which are nouns, these are particles (حروف).

The main الموصولات الحرفية are: أَنْ (that), أَنَّ (that - with emphasis), كَيْ (in order to), لَوْ (if/that), and مَا المصدرية (what/the fact that). Each combines with what follows to create a مصدر مؤول.
keyPoints: الموصول الحرفي = particles that form masdar مؤول
Five main particles: أَنْ، أَنَّ، كَيْ، لَوْ، مَا

examples.arabic: أُرِيدُ أَنْ أَتَعَلَّمَ ← أَنْ أَتَعَلَّمَ = التَّعَلُّمَ
examples.english: I want to learn -> 'to learn' = learning

examples.arabic: عَلِمْتُ أَنَّكَ نَاجِحٌ ← أَنَّكَ نَاجِحٌ = نَجَاحَكَ
examples.english: I knew you succeeded -> 'that you succeeded' = your success

examples.arabic: جِئْتُ كَيْ أَتَعَلَّمَ ← كَيْ أَتَعَلَّمَ = لِلتَّعَلُّمِ
examples.english: I came to learn -> 'to learn' = for learning

examples.arabic: وَدِدْتُ لَوْ تَزُورُنِي ← لَوْ تَزُورُنِي = زِيَارَتَكَ
examples.english: I wished you would visit -> 'that you visit' = your visiting

notes.title: أَنْ المَصْدَرِيَّة
content: أَنْ المصدرية is the most common موصول حرفي. It is followed by a فِعْل مُضَارِع which becomes مَنْصُوب (accusative). The combination أَنْ + الفعل المضارع المنصوب forms a مصدر مؤول.

أَنْ can come after certain verbs (أَفْعَال القُلُوب وَغَيْرُها) and expressions: أُرِيدُ أَنْ (I want to), يَجِبُ أَنْ (it is necessary to), أَتَمَنَّى أَنْ (I wish to), يُمْكِنُ أَنْ (it is possible to).
keyPoints: Common after: أُرِيدُ، يَجِبُ، أَتَمَنَّى، يُمْكِنُ

examples.english: I want to go to the mosque
We must be truthful in speech
It pleases me to see you

examples.arabic: عَسَى أَنْ تَكْرَهُوا شَيْئًا وَهُوَ خَيْرٌ لَكُمْ (القرآن)
examples.english: Perhaps you dislike something and it is good for you (Quran 2:216)

notes.title: أَنَّ المُشَدَّدَة وكَيْ
content: أَنَّ المشددة is followed by its اسْم (in accusative) and خَبَر. The entire clause forms a مصدر مؤول: عَلِمْتُ أَنَّكَ مُسَافِرٌ = عَلِمْتُ سَفَرَكَ (I knew your traveling). This is very common in Arabic.
كَيْ المصدرية indicates purpose and is followed by a فِعْل مُضَارِع مَنْصُوب. It means 'in order to' or 'so that': جِئْتُ كَيْ أَتَعَلَّمَ = جِئْتُ لِلتَّعَلُّمِ (I came for learning).

examples.english: It reached me that you are sick

examples.arabic: أَعْلَمُ أَنَّ اللهَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ (القرآن)
examples.english: I know that Allah is capable of all things (Quran 2:259)
I came in order to help you

notes.title: لَوْ المَصْدَرِيَّة ومَا المَصْدَرِيَّة
content: لَوْ المصدرية comes after verbs of wishing (وَدَّ، تَمَنَّى، أَحَبَّ) and means 'that' or 'if only'. It forms a مصدر مؤول: وَدُّوا لَوْ تَكْفُرُونَ (They wished that you would disbelieve). Here لَوْ تَكْفُرُونَ = كُفْرَكُمْ.

مَا المصدرية can be ظرفية (temporal) or غير ظرفية. When temporal, it means 'as long as': أُكْرِمُكَ مَا دُمْتَ صَادِقًا (I honor you as long as you are truthful). مَا دُمْتَ صَادِقًا = مُدَّةَ دَوَامِكَ صَادِقًا.
keyPoints: مَا المصدرية الظرفية = as long as

examples.english: They wish you would compromise so they would compromise (Quran 68:9)

examples.arabic: يَوَدُّ أَحَدُهُمْ لَوْ يُعَمَّرُ أَلْفَ سَنَةٍ (القرآن)
examples.english: One of them wishes to live a thousand years (Quran 2:96)
I honor you as long as you are diligent

examples.arabic: وَأَوْصَانِي بِالصَّلَاةِ وَالزَّكَاةِ مَا دُمْتُ حَيًّا (القرآن)
examples.english: And He enjoined on me prayer and charity as long as I live (Quran 19:31)

exercises.prompt: الموصولات الحرفية الخمسة هي: أَنْ، أَنَّ، كَيْ، _____، مَا
exercises.promptEn: The five particle relatives are: أَنْ، أَنَّ، كَيْ، _____، مَا
I wished _____ you would visit me (wishing)
I love you _____ you remain truthful (temporal ma)

exercises.prompt: I came in order to help you
I knew that you are a student
I honor you as long as you are truthful

exercises.answer: particle-like relative (forms masdar with following clause)
the masdariyya 'kay' (in order to / so that)

exercises.prompt: The particle used after verbs of wishing to form a masdar
The temporal particle meaning 'as long as'
